title: QuizeSCH Schema
description: A schema for an array of questions, where each question can be one of three types: multi_choice, drag_n_drop, or fill_the_blanks.

question_type.description: Defines the type of the question.

question_title.description: The main text of the question.

options.description: An object where keys are option identifiers (e.g., 'a', 'b') and values are the option text.

answer.description: An array of strings, where each string is a key from the 'options' object, representing a correct answer.

ID.description: A unique identifier for the question.

supervised.description: A flag indicating if the question is supervised.

question_type.description: Defines the type of the question.

choices.description: An array of all possible choices (both correct answers and distractors).

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the choice (e.g., 'field1', 'distractor1').

label.description: The text content of the choice.

text.description: The question text containing placeholders like [field1] that correspond to identifiers in the 'choices' array.

ID.description: A unique identifier for the question.

supervised.description: A flag indicating if the question is supervised.

question_type.description: Defines the type of the question.

text.description: The question text containing placeholders like [field1] that correspond to identifiers in the 'blank' property.

blank.description: Can be a single blank object or an array of blank objects, each representing a correct answer for a placeholder.

identifier.description: The identifier for the blank, matching a placeholder in the text.

answer.description: The correct answer for the blank.
